16606733.review:
[h1]Guns, Gore & Cannoli	[/h1]

"Join the Mafia, meet interesting people, then whack em."

Guns, Gore  Cannoli is a mobster style 2D shooter and platformer. The graphics are polished and the gameplay is enjoyable. 

[h1]Weapons	[/h1]

Through this game you will find 8 weapons, each showing something different. You will start off with a basic pistol that has infinite reload. But soon you will find a shotgun, a flamethrower, a tommy, an electricity gun, and 3 other weapons


[h1]Gameplay	[/h1] 

The gameplay was highly enjoyable and supports controllers. You start off as Vinnie Cannoli, an enforcer of the mob who has been hired by Mr. Bellucio to find Frankie the Fly. You head to the destination of your job "Thug Town". Soon you will be fighting fellow mobsters, zombies, mutant rats and of course the army. This game is set in the 1920's. Throughout the whole game it really gave that classic mobster feel. The game has everything you would find in a normal mob movie. The combat is nice and fluent and you will find a number of enemies and a few bosses.

[h1]Consider buying this/ not buying this if	[/h1]

[b] Consider buying this if: [/b]
- you love platformers
- you like a nice little story
- you like mobster movies
- you love shooting zombies/mutants/army guy/mobsters
- you love cannoli
- you just want a nicely overall designed game

[b] Consider not buying this if:	[/b]
- you hate 2D platformers
- you hate zombies
- you hate the mob
- you hate cannoli
- you hate fun 

[h1]Final Thoughts	[/h1]

This game was highly enjoyable through the time I have played it. It had everything I expected with a mobster and the mafia. It had a satisfying ending. For some reason I really liked the name Vinnie Cannoli and now I'll want to try Cannoli.
I would recommend this game to my friends because of its art, gameplay, story, and mobsters. I also hear skins are coming, so  [i]YAY[/i]. I really don't have anything negative to say on this game's behalf because I enjoyed the game so much.


[i]If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url][/i]

16606165.review:
[b]Guns, Gore & Cannoli[/b] is a 2D zombie Shoot 'Em Up indie game. As you might expect, it includes guns, gore and, you guessed it, cannoli. Vinnie, who has a mission in Thugtown, is one of the rare humans still in town. Zombies are all around it, but luckily, he gets a few guns to fight them. And man, was that a fun fight!
You want ups and downs, right? There you go:

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Despite its style, this game actually has a really good story. I don't want to spoil it, but it exceeded my expectations. The story is evolving, more people are getting involved in the story ...
    [*]Graphics. There are lots of blood and explosions everywhere and they look awesome. Characters also look really nice. By the way, the whole game is hand-drawn. Awesome.
    [*]If you are into weapons, this is the game to play. It features pistols, machine guns, shotguns, flamethrowers ... you name it!
    [*]Different zombie types. There are crawling ones, running ones, shooting ones and more.
    [*]Co-op! You can play with your friends if you have controllers! It's only local, however.
    [*]Achievements, Trading Cards and Steam Cloud are present.
    [*]The price is pretty low.
    [*][b]The developer is super nice.[/b] I've talked to him and he is an awesome person, he is also keeping his game updated and is open to suggestions. Right now, for example, he is accepting suggestions for new main character skins.
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
    [*]No Linux support. Sorry, Crazy Monkey Studios, but I'm a Linux freak ;)
    [*]No online multiplayer support. This game could be just as fun as BattleBlock Theater with it. What's better than playing with your friends?
    [*]I would [i]really[/i] enjoy this game much more with mouse controlled aiming. At least consider enabling this for the easiest difficulty.
    [*]Sometimes, there's not enough health pickups. Could be just me playing bad, though.
[/list]

[h1]Wuts?!?:[/h1]
[list]
    [*]One of the options in the settings menu is "Flip cutscenes upside down". What the heck is this good for? Am I missing something out?
[b]EDIT[/b]: I spoke to the dev and he said that some people had their cutscenes upside down. The easiest way to solve this was apparently the option I mentioned above. Interesting.
[/list]

[h1]The final verdict:[/h1]
I like it and you should, too. It's super fun, has an awesome story and even includes some humour in it. It offers great relaxation on the easy mode and a painful challenge on the hardest mode, if that's what you're looking for. Co-op is a very nice addition, but you need real life friends to sit next to you.
The graphics are hand-drawn and look amazing. The developer is active and cooperates with community. You should give this game a try. 

Greetings,
Bird

Note that my copy of this game was obtained for free for reviewing purposes. However, this did not affect the quality and objectivity of this review.

16472576.review:
Got the Alive and Kickin' achievement after so much pain and anguish....SO TAKE THAT, SADISTIC DEV TEAM! I beat your little challenge. Muhahahahahahaha.....*Ahem* excuse me.

But time to be serious here now. Guns, Gore & Cannoli I found to be a pretty enjoyable game. It plays alot like Metal Slug is what I have heard from other people although I have never played a Metal Slug game before so I wouldn't know personally.

Regardless though, the bloody and fast paced action, the good variety of satisfying to use weapons, the cartooney graphics,  the many (and I mean many) references to Mafia films and novels (The don of the crime family looks like Vito Corleone for crying out loud) and the overall satire of the game really helped to bring the game alive for me.

I mean there is nothing quite like blowing the heads of a clustered group of 8 zombies with one shot from a double barrel shotgun in a beautiful looking shower of blood, guts and bits of zombie flying everywhere while the angry and extremely determined mafioso we have for a protagonist spouts a Goodfellas themed one liner to underline just how an over-the-top video game like this should be, FUN. I wouldn't have it any other way.

Also, fuck those quarterbacks! If you see them then make sure to introduce them to a little Italian-American hospitality in the form of a pump action shotgun to their snarling faces, capiche?

16229220.review:
Surprisingly good game. The dev contacted me and asked for some impressions, but I already had this on my radar before. Its pretty short with 2-3 hours for a first playthrough (so maybe keep an eye on it during the Steam sales if that is important to you), but the VERY challenging higher difficulties and challenges through achievements (beat X level by doing Y, etc) add a lot of replayability to it. Its also just... plain fun. Throughout those 2-3 hours, the game constantly introduces new enemy types and a wide range of weapons, so you always have something new to play around with/learn and the level design/enemy hordes keep you on your toes for most of the game.

Another thing worth mentioning is the polish, which I havent found often in such a game. In contrast du many other 2D platformers, it uses a VERY well done comic style, nunanced through snarky comments, a very moody soundtrack and extremely pretty animations. I had more than one moment, where I was marvelling at small graphical details, like the multiple subtle layers of background animations, very fluid character animations, extremely satisfying killing animations or small details like an in-style animated water shadow when you are walking in water or ... splashes from bullet cases hitting the water:

http://i.imgur.com/ZjRq5bW.gif

This game is drenched in love for making games, I am really surprised to see it seems to be one of the devs first efforts into game developing (at least according to the devs website). Apparently the dev is also working on a horde/MP mode to alleviate the playtime concerns. Really fun game, definitely recommended.

16189694.review:
Prima di tutto, va detto che Guns, Gore & Cannoli è gioco abbastanza genuino. Gli sviluppatori belgi non hanno certo nascosto la loro grande passione per il capolavoro di SNK e, al contrario, si sono impegnati nel cercare di omaggiarlo il più possibile. Di fatto, il gameplay del loro gioco non si discosta di una virgola dal furioso e caotico Metal Slug, offrendo tonnellate di nemici di vario tipo che ci assaliranno man mano che procederemo durante i quadri, nella speranza di fermarci dal compimento della nostra missione. Questa certamente non è niente di che, ricalcando gli stilemi classici di una proto-storia di base mafiosa, ma rappresentando molto bene l’ambientazione tra quartieri malfamati, locali di dubbia frequentazione e, soprattutto, un’ottima scrittura dei testi che sono stati adattati in italiano con grande perizia. Non è tanto l’utilizzo di qualche “minchia” o del più ammeregano “capisc” (nella nostra versione tradotto come “capisti”), ma perfino l’utilizzo di parole che perfino nelle produzioni italiane ambientate in Sicilia (a sfondo mafioso) spesso si vedono omettere nonostante l’uso piuttosto comune.

In ogni caso, vestiremo i panni di Vinnie Cannoli, serial killer assoldato per salvare un certo scagnozzo che condivide con il nostro Frankie non solo il nome, ma anche la pericolosità. Da questo piccolo escamotage narrativo percorreremo diversi quartieri di questa parte di città ormai infestata da zombi frutti di esperimenti particolari. Il level design di questi livelli risulta essere piuttosto vario, non necessariamente piano, ma spesso e volentieri con la necessità di esplorare in maniera verticale per continuare nell’avventura. Non mancano porte che nascondono bonus e, in generale, la poca esplorazione finisce quasi sempre per premiare il giocatore con riserve di armi odi cannoli, in sostituzione dei più classici medikit. Alla stessa maniera del sommo Metal Slug, in Guns, Gore & Cannoli avremo un signor assortimento di armi: pistole, magnum, lupara, lanciafiamme, lanciarazzi, fino ad arrivare a uno spara fulmini in grado di annientare qualsiasi cosa si muova. Sicuramente una versione migliorata del gioco SNK, dato che ora potremo portare con noi tutte le armi e, anzi, è decisamente consigliato capire quale arma usare in base all’occasione e al nemico affrontato.

Vieni a leggere la recensione completa su TheShelterNetwork.com:
http://theshelternetwork.com/guns-gore-cannoli/

16128011.review: I have only played 3 hours in this game, but that is more than enough to get through the few level story, BUT I spent all that time in succession, and didn't want to turn the game off. It has a beautiful art style, and makes its levels very enjoyable to be in. The 1920's Prohibition-Era Chicago looks amazing, with several real world references (i.e. Capone's Soup Kitchen). The experience is mostly linear, with the only "exploring" being entering a door or window off the main path for ammo. The gameplay is exactly what it should be for this kind of game, simple platforming elements in some segments, with linear 2D shooting being the main element. The basic keyboard controls were confusing at first, but you can customize the controls however you want. The story isn't much, but the few cutscenes are very polished and are filled with nice voiceovers of the characters. The protagonist is a mob enforcer, and he is can be sarcastic and makes several jokes throughout the game. The only real complaint I have, and it's only because I like this game so much, is I wish it was longer. This game is definitely worth your money.

16126862.review:
You are Vinnie an enforcer who has been tasked with recovering an asset named Frankie by one of the big crime bosses. To accomplish your task you are going to have to sneak into ThugTown and find Frankie, there's only one small issue, it appears that something bad has happened to the people of ThugTown, and now they are all walking zombies.

In Guns, Gore & Cannoli, you will have to utilize your proficiencies with different guns to fight your way through wave upon wave of zombies, rival mobsters, mutant rats, and even the military. There are plenty of twists and turns in this game that will definitely keep you guessing.

Now you might have noticed I mentioned guns, plural, that's because you will be handling pistols, shotguns, rocket launchers, flamethrowers and more. You just have to make sure you keep a good stock of ammo, if not you might find the path through ThugTown gets a little bit harder. Personally I liked to have the magnum with me, it has a tendency of taking off multiple heads as it tears through one victim to the next. You will also have grenades and molotov cocktails at your disposal, just to spice things up.

This was one of these games that definitely got my attention. It looks amazing, and it plays like many of the old school games that I grew up with. There was enough difficulty to keep things interesting,  and there was enough action to allow me to lose track of time.

One of the biggest issues I have with games that send wave upon wave of enemies at you is that they all look the same, and yes there was a stream of like faced individuals, but there was enough variety that I was never distracted. One of the main reasons was that different looking enemies actually attacked in different ways. You had the football player that would bull rush you, you had a butcher that would throw cutlery at you and then EXPLODE upon death, hell you even had leprechauns hanging upside down throwing toxic bottles while floating by on balloons.

Another thing that put a smile on my face was the witty comments that Vinnie added to the game from time to time, sure it did start to get a bit old with his "That's some GOOD Cannoli", but for the most part is sarcastic over the top badassery comments just seemed to flow right with the game.

Oh and did I mention that not only can you play this game solo, but you can bring along 3 of your friends. This to me puts the game over the top, we're talking about a game that allows more than one person to play the game on a single computer, and all of them kicking ass at the same time.

The only thing that made me sad was the fact that the game/story had to end. After almost playing through without wanting to stop, I need to find out what Vinnie is going to do next, or what he did in the past. I need more Vinnie action, and I'm hoping that maybe, just maybe we can see a sequel or prequel of this game because this game was above and beyond solid, and is needed on anyone's system. This game gets a 9.3 out of 10.

16113482.review: What would happen if you took Metal Slug, put it in the prohibition era, and gave it a mobster story? You probably would get Guns, Gore & Cannoli. While it isn't a long game, and only took me about two hours to beat, it was two hours of fun zombie and gangster fun. Кровища, куски мяса, вопли умирающих, вагон оружия и канноли. Кстати, канноли - это печенье с начинкой, которые наш гангстер уплетает, чтобы восстановить здоровье. Говорит, что очень вкусно! :-) 

Игра просто идеальна: разнообразные уровни, приятное музыкальное сопровождение, приличное разнообразие противников (всякие заражённые, крысы-мутанты, солдаты и конечно гангстеры). 

В процессе уничтожения супостатов выяснится, что разные враги требуют индивидуального подхода. Не всех можно просто поливать свинцом от бедра из Томми-гана. Например здоровяка-бандита, прикрывающегося стальной крышкой, сперва нужно хорошенько пнуть, чтобы он потерял равновесие и открылся для выстрела.

Постоянно приходится быть начеку, так как зажатый толпой заражённых людей или крыс, Винни очень трудно будет остаться в живых. Особенно на высоких уровнях сложности. Поэтому придётся иногда умирать. Чтобы потом воскреснуть на ближайшем чек-поинте и продолжить истребление в промышленных масштабах.

Ставлю игре 10 из 10, а такое бывает ну очень редко.

16001939.review:
An excellent little game that is well worth your money. It plays like a cross between a Metal Slug game and the old arcade classic Rolling Thunder. I compare it to Rolling Thunder mostly because you can only shoot horizontally. While this seems a design flaw at first, it soon instead becomes an integral part of the gameplay that will greatly affect your tactics. Add in some fantastic hand-drawn art, voice, music (roaring 20s style) and sound and this is a gem of side-scrolling shooter. 12 levels that take about 20 minutes each deliver great value for the 7 quid I paid for it. It's hard in places but the check points are very liberally spread around so it rarely becomes frustrating. Highly recommended.

EDIT: Just completed the game on Hard. Already wanting to play it again, it is THAT fun. Upping review score from 8 to 9.

An easy 9/10

15957240.review:
[b]TL;DR[/b]: If blasting zombies in a 1920's apocalypse sounds good to you, give it a go.

[i][b]Guns, Gore & Cannoli[/b][/i] is a fun, brainless shooter that breathes much needed life into a tired and wheezing genre.

You play Vinnie Cannoli, a 1920's hitman who gets sent into Thugtown to retrieve fellow mobster Frankie. But all is not well. Before Cannoli has time to get his bearings, the ship is awash with rotting lunatics. Best grab your guns and persuade these walking stiffs to a horizontal lifestyle!

Right off the bat the monster design, the guns, and the atmospheric soundtrack grabs hold of you and refuses to let go. Every gun has a purpose, every mob a weakness; it's up to you to experiment and find out what works. For example: Try getting close to the hatchet-throwing zombies and use your sawed-off shotgun.

Now for the problems (and there are a bunch). The game gets pretty frustrating due to its sparsely placed checkpoints and punishing game mechanics. One unlucky jump and you're right back where you started. This is an issue, especially on mouse and keyboard, since you'll be doing a lot of jumping in this game.

Then there are the boss fights, which are just tiresome. They break up the flow of the game for no apparent reason other than “here's a boss fight!”. And then you die, and have to start all over again.

Okay, so here's a drinking game for you: Take a shot every time you spot a stereotype or someone says the word “Cannoli”. You'll be drunk off your ass in no time.

On the bright side, I encountered one (count 'em, one!) bug in my entire playthrough. Twice, enemies got stuck in the scenery, which meant I had to pry them loose. With a shotgun blast to the unmentionables.

15930922.review:
[b] < Disclaimer!! I got this game for free for reviewing purposes > [/b]

Mafia meets zombies and infected rats in a 2d shooting adventure!

Guns, Gore & Cannoli is a very weird name for a game but it basically explains some of it
An interesting 2d platformer that combines comedy and yet stays serious 

[h1] About the game [/h1]

You're Vinnie Cannoli, a very badass mob guy, I mean really he is your typical tough as nails mafia dude that shoots and asks questions later and his character is very well-made and the voicing is outstanding.
You basically start shooting zombies with a pistol and finding more different guns as you play.

The designs looks really good, the cutscenes are great, the music and sound effects are also something to admire, and the gameplay is pretty cool.

- About 12 levels, packed with action, zombies, mobsters and much more.
Although 12 levels might not seem that much, but each level is actually pretty long and takes time to finish.
- 4 Difficulty levels to choose between that can be changed in-game any time.
- Local co-op up to 4 players, although I feel like it was mainly meant for one guy to play it because it was fun playing it alone, but the local coop certainly adds some spice to the game and more fun.
- kick, shoot or throw bombs at your enemies, jump or duck to avoid their attacks and travel between platforms and kick more stuff to reach the end of the level.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]
- With fully re-bindable keys you can design them however you want which is cool.
- The game is not too crazy that type that gets you frustrated, pretty reasonable with great check points and many cannoli's to find on the ground to restore your hp, that said its also not too easy.
- The boss fights in the game are great, feels real and intense.
- All kinds of enemies to encounter with weaknesses and attacks.
- Interesting and fun levels to play.

And all in all the game feels great, to shoot and kick zombies and to throw explosives or blowup cars, it has its downsides but i'll get to that in a minute.

[h1] Whats good [/h1] 
- The music, the level and character design, the sound effects and pretty much everything.
- The story and the comedy and dialogues and the lines the character says while playing.
- The achievements in the game are nice, not too crazy, steam cloud and controller support and trading cards.
- Boss fights, enemies, difficulty and well a lot of parts of the game are pretty good.
- The game's length and the time it takes to finish it and get the achievements.
- Local coop with 4 players.

[h1]Whats not so good[/h1]

I kinda feel that how the game plays is not done right, for an example when the zombies attacks you they just come close to you and basically touches you while doing the attack animation which looks great but feels that you're not being attacked just being slowed down. And making it harder to jump and perform actions.
So kinda feeling that its just not done right.

Also the aiming, you cant really change the aiming you shoot forward and it tilts up or down if you're injured or jumping, so gets kinda hard to shoot zombies that are under the hill so you'll always need to wait in a horizontal place to kill them or jump behind them and shoot them which will usually get you injured if you timed it wrong 


[h1]TL;DR[/h1]

A very fun to play action-packed zombie and mafia killing game, with a good story, funny dialogues and challenging gameplay. And its for 9.99$ so the price is worth it, if you're into zombies or mafia or just 2D platformers that looks like this, then you should probably get this game because its doing it right.




 [i] This review was written while i was a part of the original traders group OTG, however you can trust that the review was not effected by that fact, I was not forced to lie or anything, you can read it and judge for yourself, all my reviews are honest and I am no longer a part of the group. [/i]

15925493.review:
Про Guns, Gore & Cannoli я узнал в тот самый момент, когда написал короткую новость о скором выходе. Тогда экшен Crazy Monkey Studios показался мне тотальными рескином Shank: дикого и яростного мексиканца заменили гангстером, сотрудников картеля на зомби - и вуаля, забирайте новинку. Но на деле игра скорее уходит корнями в покрывшуюся пылью Contra или даже Metal Slug - список занятий примерно тот же: прыг-скок, пиф-паф. И так на протяжении шести часов.

Удивительно, но описанного оказалось вполне достаточно, чтобы получить удовольствие за скромные 249 руб. Пускай глубоко внутри CCG пыхтит древняя механика двухмерного одностикового шутера (стрелять можно только по прямой, стоя или сидя, а рулить прицелом напрямую не дают), но перестрелки вышли настолько жаркими, что ныть по поводу некоторой неповоротливости главного героя просто нет времени. Враги прут почти сплошным потоком, иногда атакуют с тыла и исподтишка, частенько приходится уворачиваться от летящих предметов и гранат, а редкие секунды передышки необходимо тратить на поиск боеприпасов. Пролетают уровни, меняются локации, на смену тупым мертвецам приходят более изворотливые мафиози и солдаты с тяжёлым вооружением, а игра не сбавляет темп. И даже более размеренный уровень в городской канализации не даёт расслабиться злобными резвыми крысами-мутантами.

Между делом авторы иронизируют над классикой "бандитского" кинематографа, жонглируют мифами об итальянской мафии и дразнят фанатов живой мертвечины совершенно нелепым объяснением зомби-эпидемии. Главный герой в пальто и шляпе, буквально рвущий врагов на части, отмачивает забавные шутки-прибаутки. В результате имеем отличную, ни разу не пошлую комедию положений про лихого парня Винни Канноли, очутившегося в эпицентре апокалипсиса.

А боссы... Боссы вам напомнят минувшие времена: для победы придётся не только много и метко стрелять, но и заучивать паттерны их поведения, вырабатывать тактику и сквозь многочисленные смерти рваться к победе. Финальная битва, кто бы сомневался, жопоразрывательна. Хотя и сама игра уже на среднем уровне сложности может приятно (или неприятно - зависит от вашей закалки) удивить.

Единственный серьёзный недостаток - ближе к концу от Guns, Gore & Cannoli немного устаёшь. Насилие, кишки, кровища и оторванные конечности - это, конечно, всегда здорово, но за шесть часов неспешного прохождения к ним настолько привыкаешь, что перестаёшь обращать внимание. И тогда резко контрастирующая стилистика 20-х годов прошлого века перестаёт играть хоть какое-то значение и из жирного плюса превращается в ноль.

В остальном, мои пламенные рекомендации.

http://www.vgblogs.ru/2015/05/guns-gore-and-cannoli-mnenie.html

15922434.review:
When I first saw this game on Greenlight, I was interested but concerened, it looked ok gameplay wise, but honestly it looked like a typical garbage game from Newgrounds that you'd find common in Greenlight these days.

Boy was I wrong. I was very wrong.

Guns, Gore & Cannoli is like a expensive dessert at a restaurant, it's small, doesn't take very long to eat, and just like an expensive dessert, it's amazingly satisfying the moment you take your bites, chew it, savor it, and then some.

In this game you play as a hired gun (He says he's an Enforcer for the Mob but it's never explained what family he belonged to), named Vinnie Cannoli. He was hired by a big time Mob Boss named Mr. Bellucio to travel to his hometown of Thugville, USA to find a guy named "Frankie the Fly". Seemed simple enough, but a few days before during Thugtown's celebration of Saint Patrick's Day, Zombies started appearing  from seemingly nowhere, and over the next few days it was overun. 

Your job? Gun your way through a bunch of zombies, 1920s Gangster style to find Frankie, uncover the mystery about the Zombies, and hopefully find a way to escape before the Military cleans up (as per Zombie anything cliche).

The Gameplay is a side scrolling platforming shooter, like say Contra. You grab guns, ammo, and throwables to kill zombies, you move to the right until you reach the end of a level, simple as that right?

Nope, Zombies are surprisingly challenging sometimes, but never to a point where it's impossible. Zombies range from the typical slow walkers, to rage fueled runners, fat guys that explode, gassy zombies that belch acid gas, and more. If you're not careful as you fight level from level, you can very easily die, as Health is only found at checkpoints, however it might appear that more health spawns on higher difficulties, this has yet to be confirmed.

BUT, it's not all Zombies though, there are also living enemies too, like Mafiosos and the Military sent in to "Clean Up". They're even more challenging because they have the ability to shoot back with guns and toss grenades to keep you away.

And  the Difficulty adds to that too. It's not noticeable on Easy, and it's kind of on Normal, but Hard mode is when poop hits the fan big time. We're talking more fast runners zerg rushing you, and big charging zombies taking almost 25% of your health off with each hit. I can't wait to see what Impossible brings.

There are plenty of nice weapons to use on the Undead and not yet Undead citizens of Thugtown, from your 1911 with Infinite Ammo capacity, to the classic Tommy Gun, and others I won't spoil in this review.

Level design is good, you'll never get lost or stuck, an the obstacles are tricky at points, but again, never impossible. 

Art wise I'm really impressed, Backgrounds and character design is nice and cartoony, the animation is also impressive too for a cheap indie game. The voice acting is also a nice touch, cheesy at times, but Vinnie's a likeable wiseguy, being an analgamation of just about every single Italian New York Mobster from the 1920s rolled into someone that kinda looks like Totalbiscuit with a fedora.

As for how long it is, like I said in the beginning, it's not a long game, you can beat this in a day, but you will leave feeling so satisfied that you'll want to replay the game on a harder difficulty like I'm doing right now. But I imagine the game's length increases with the harder difficulties.

Overall this game is a surprise, what I thought was going to be a one note Greenlight game, instead turned into a wonderful, and cheap, game that has replayability, and a nice speedy install time where you can just install and play the whole thing again later on when you're bored playing Triple AAA games.

Pros:

-A short but fun story involving Mobsters, Zombies, and Saint Patrick's Day
-Gunplay is solid and feels good, with plenty of guns to play with.
-Enemies and Environment are challenging enough to make you want to replay the whole game on harder difficulties, and since the story is short, you won't feel like wasting time replaying the same levels.
- Well produced Art and Voice acting adds real charm to this game, elevating it from the typical artsy pixel games, and garbage runoff from Newgrounds

Cons:

-No Online play, but I have a feeling that will change eventually if we ask the devs after a while, but otherwise if you've got a mate with you in real life, the 4 player co op should suffice.
-Short Story, I really want more of this game, If these guys ever do a sequel, it should be longer and just as fun as this game is.

Overall Opinion: You should definantly buy this game, it's fun, short and sweet, and only $10, probably less come Summer Sale.

Но прелесть этой игры в большей части не за счет их,но и не без их участия. Потрясающая 2D графика с нарисованной картинкой. Стильный саундреки ,колкие шутки в стиле гангстерских фильмов. Бугаи с трубами бьют рыгающих баб-зомби.Неопытный,начинающий гангстер стреляет в бочку и подрывает пять своих братюнь от чего те разлетаются на руки и ноги. Бывалый с шотганом подходит в плотную и всаживает в зомби одетого в элегантный костюм в шляпе. Летающие "хер пойми что" с газовыми бомбами смеясь нападают на военных в хим-защите и гранатометами и огнеметами. И по среди всего этого наш главный герой с великолепным юмором и брутальностью Т-90. Воевать придется со всеми. Воевать нужно будет всевозможными пушками того времени. От пистолета до огнеметов. Так же некие "секретные разработки" в виде электропушки. Интерактивные обьекты работают как за вас,так и против. Пропущенная бочка может вас спасти а может и погубить, если меткий гангста пальнет в нее или вояка, без палева стрельнувший в нее с гранатомета.В процессе прохождения будут не только враги люди,но и мутанты. Промежуточные боссы, большое кол-во локаций и разнообразие игровых ситуаций будут приятно удивлять и радовать в кубе с красивой картинкой.Любителям Крузиса строго на выход. Так же игру можно проходить на одном компе в четыре рыла в локальном co-op режиме . Градус веселья поднимется и фана получится намного больше.
Всем любителям 2D . Всем любителям гангстерского времени и духа той эпохи. Всем любителям Томми-гана и конечно же зомби тематике эта игра безусловно понравится . O4EN HOROSHO

Отличная игра. Больше всего напоминает старый-добрый Metal Slug на автоматах - харизматичный главный герой, толпы колоритных врагов, которые периодически  схватываются друг с другом,  и крайне энергичный игровой процесс.  

Очень, очень симпатичная мультяшная графика, хорошее музыкальное сопровождение, большой бестиарий и широкий выбор оружия для его уничтожения, включая ручной (!) пулемет  Максима и пушку Тесла. 
В качестве бонуса - антураж 20-ых годов типичного американского мегаполиса, босс мафии, срисованный с Марлона Брандо, ВНЕЗАПНЫЕ повороты сюжета и боссы, включая финального - убиваемого в несколько заходов - еще один реверанс в сторону Metal Slug.

Крайне симпатичная, веселая и в меру сложная игра  на пару вечеров.

15876556.review:
I can't really recommend with game.

Run and guns can't really sweat clumsy controls. It has to be nervous and tight. These games tend to be focused on reflexes, jump trajectories, shooting timing, like a shoot'em up with gravity. Guns, Gore & Cannoli is nothing like that.

Believe it or not, with its badass lines, it's cartoonish look, and its promotional videos pumped with action... this game feels and plays more like a survival platformer where you can jump really high than an action game.

Every weapons has to be reloaded. Its not just the counterpart to the infinite ammo of the basic small gun, you have to watch out for your clips so you don't get caught reloading with zombies on you. You only have so much ammo for each gun at any given moment, so you have to keep swapping weapons to keep a steady output of damage going on. Most weapon are only effective if you shoot the head (double damage)... but you can't aim, so you're constantly trying to kick enemies or jump up slopes to level your gun sight with the enemies' heads. You can't really outrun the running mobs, so each time they run on you while you reload, you have to run for a long time before safely turn back and shoot them. And when monsters manage to get a grab on you, you can only jump at the minimum height, you keep being stunned, and since it bumps your avatar sideways, your aim changes accordingly, making you shoot the ceiling instead of the enemies.

The only working approach I could think is to walk carefully, take on small groups of enemies, always retreat when run onto, handle each situation separately and spare ammo so that you don't run out of it. This is NOT how a run and gun should be played, but that's the only way I can think of playing that game.

So in the end I COULD recommend this survival gory game, but the physics are bumpy as hell. You don't lose life because the game is hard, you lose life because controls are hard.

It's not very expensive though, so if you want to prove me wrong, be my guest and try it for yourself.

15874993.review:
Siempre me han gustado los híbridos extraños y hasta un punto bizarros. Engendros que sólo la cultura pulp es capaz de generar y dirigidos a saciar a aquellos que se han criado engullendo todo tipo de producto cultural supeditando el placer estético por el lúdico. Guns, Gore & Cannolli nace como un hijo bastardo de muchos padres, pero si tenemos en cuenta que entre esos padres se encuentran Metal Slug, Contra, El Padrino o La noche de los muertos vivientes, pues que quieren, un servidor está dispuesto a arropar a ese bastardo como si del hijo pródigo se tratara.

Y es que como buen producto pulp, Guns, Gore & Cannolli en ningún momento intenta ocultar sus influencias, es más, alardea de ellas como principal seña de identidad. Sus mecánicas de juego se enmarcan en el subgénero del Run&Gun, muy de moda a principios de los noventa y que sagas como Metal Slug convirtieron en referente de toda una generación. De este último no sólo coge sus bases jugables, sino también su estética y gusto por la destrucción masiva. No sólo podremos reventar zombies, también dispondremos de un buen arsenal con el que detonar coches, los inevitables bidones, puentes y todo tipo de mobiliario urbano que ose cruzarse en nuestro camino. Además dispondremos de un bonito arsenal que a diferencia del clásico Metal Slug, se irá acumulando en nuestro inventario, facilitando sobremanera nuestra labor destructiva.

Si bien la mecánica del juego está directamente sacada de los shooters de principios de los noventa, en su intento por hacer un producto más accesible (y por tanto más fácil) para el gran público se han dejado algo de la épica y dificultad que caracterizaba a los títulos clásicos y en los que conseguir pasar de pantalla o derrotar al final boss era una proeza digna de ser mentada en tu C.V. Aquí todo es mucho más sencillo, mucho más friendly. Morimos poco, (excepto en algún momento puntual) y tampoco nos encontramos con los mastodónticos final boss de antaño que daban ese subidón de adrenalina que tan imborrables recuerdos produjo.

Hay jefes finales, y algunos realmente complicados, pero nunca llegan a la locura masoquista de los bosses que pretende homenajear. El estudio indie Crazy Monkeys ha rendido un divertidísimo homenaje creando un sencillo y directo shooter que cuida cada una de sus facetas de producción empezando por la artística: veremos un Chicago de los años 30 recreado con cariño a través de dibujos pintados a mano que evocan los escenarios que hemos visto en múltiples películas de gangsters y en el que no faltan zombies explotando por doquier. Si a esto le sumamos un estilo cartoon con toneladas de gore que salpican literalmente la pantalla, no podemos más que postrarnos ante semejante bizarrada.

No hay duda que han conseguido un producto sólido y que funciona a las mil maravillas, no sólo como el homenaje a clásicos del cine y del videojuego, si no sobretodo como un shooter directo y tremendamente divertido que nos recuerda como la simplicidad de mecánicas unido a unos cuidados valores artísticos y de producción dan como resultado un producto que consigue plenamente su objetivo, devolver el mejor sabor de los shotters Run&Gun a todos aquellos que se criaron reventando enemigos a base de granadas y cañonazos. Un placer que  este juego nos recuerda que nunca hay que dejar de practicar.

15849940.review:
Guns, Gore & Cannoli:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  

Guns, Gore & Cannoli is a platformer set in the 1920’s. You will play “Vinnie Cannoli” who was payed big bucks to rescue “Frankie,” a very important acquaintance of a mob boss call Mr. Bellucio! 

You arrive from the sea in “Thugtown”, dressed with your coat, slick blue hat and a small gun in your pocket.  Everything seems to be upside down in this town and soon you will find yourself in a action-packed story fighting zombies (1920??????) , gangsters and the military. 

Your arsenal is very thin at the start of the game, but it will increase quite rapidly, and thank god for that! The likes of the 2 barrels shotgun, Magnum, Thomson (machine gun), grenades, Molotov cocktails, Bazooka and even a Flamethrower will be put at your disposal to kill all your enemies! 

This game has a marvellous atmosphere with its cartoon graphics and superb soundtracks. The levels are well designed and if you are like me, starting most platformers at the normal difficulty, you will probably find this game a tad challenging.  

In terms of the controls, you can use a game pad or your mouse and keyboard. I actually prefer playing it with the mouse and keyboard.

Positives:
~~~~~~~~  

-	Great cartoons style graphics
-	Superb soundtracks
-	Runs smoothly
-	Addictive and really fun to play
-	Trading cards
-	Achievements

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~ 

-	Can be frustrating in some levels

A great game to own. Fun, addictive and.... Zombies in the 1920’s! 

9/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

15803804.review:
Just to point that out first, I love the game, but something felt a bit strange when I played for the first time. 
[h1]This was originally intended as a post on forums, think nothing of it, because it's going to feel like one.[/h1]
 When I was done standing in one place at the very start, right after starting new game and shooting that M1911, reloading, shooting some more, reloading, shooting even more observing brass eject and marvelling at how detailed and awesome reload animations and [b]sounds[/b](!) are..I was wondering how do I aim. Figured the game was about to walk me through, first basic movements then the rest. But as I played, I couldn't move my aim. Is this how it was supposed to be, or am I missing something? I mean, when I watched the trailers I didn't pay attention, I was just expecting some kind of aiming, since there is shooting involved, right? When I realized I can't, I thought that maybe all the aiming is based on positioning yourself accordingly, depending on where you want to hit; body or head. I thought I fell on my head, but I didn't see any other way of aiming left.
  Despite all this confusion, and being unable to decide what to think at first, I absolutely love how the game looks, plays, and sounds. And just to add one more thing; this game is about the second one I've ever seen to take weapon reloading animations more seriously than just [i]SLAP! There, done![/i] being a 2D sidescroller. Maybe most people pay no attention, I don't know but after [b]Spec Ops: The Line[/b] I thought I won't see weapon animations receive that much love, as they get in 1st person shooters for a while. To find animations of guns that beautiful and detailed in a 2D sidescroller was the biggest surprise, and a very pleasant one. For that, I salute the whole development team, including the sound department - hell of a job. 
  Lastly, the only reason I would voice my concern of aiming, and bother anyone reading was because I couldn't see my role in deciding where I want my shots to go. I'm talking here about headshots mainly. Honestly, I was sad that it seems the only way to get headshots was "like this", especially since they're so well done and satisfying and I'm one of those who hates Aim assist. Of course, there is none in this game, but leaving my left hand unfulfilled with nothing to do but left mouse button to shoot only makes me a little bit sad. Other than that, brilliant game!

Welcome to Thugtown circa 1920, the height of Prohibition. 
Prepare yourself for a non-stop, action-packed, completely over-the-top, fast-pased, platform game. Set against the gangster heyday of the roaring twenties. Lose yourself in an exciting, elaborate tale of the underground and underworld. Experience friendship, betrayal, vengeance, and witness first hand the rise and fall of a criminal mastermind.

"Leave the gun, take the cannoli... actually, on second thought, take the gun and eat the cannoli, you’re gonna need it." 

The game tells the story of Vinnie Cannoli and his mob family, set in the fictional Thugtown circa 1925, the height of prohibition. Beneath the city overrun by zombies, there's a dark story of conspiracy and betrayal. Unravel the sneaky mafia ways and government conspiracy while you try to look for your lost pal and for answers about the zombie-outbreak.  - Highly Recommended!

15773845.review:
Guns, Gore & Cannoli is a platformer packed with action guns and explosions. In the game you play as Vinnie, you are given a mission to go to a city and rescue this "Frankie" guy for a mob boss but when you arrive at the city, you realize it's been overrun by zombies and controlled by gangsters. 

[b] Positives: [/b]
+Great cartoon art style.
+Decent Story.
+Lots of enemies + enemy varieties.
+Lots of cool guns.
+Each level/stage is different, you're not going to run into the same level twice.
+Cool main character.
+Voice acting is done really well.
+Amazing final boss.
+Good boss battles in general.
+Challenging, it's not just another run and gun game, you also need to take cover and try to snipe enemies, which I like.
+Local Co-op
+Low price tag.
+Replayability

[b] Negatives: [/b]
- No online multiplayer.
-Game is only around 5-6 hours long if you play it at a relaxed pace.
-Some areas are frustrating but not too much so it's not that bad.
-Some enemies have weapons that are stronger than yours and you can't pick those weapons up.

[b] Added notes: [/b] 
Honestly I don't have that much bad stuff to say about this game, the negatives was just a bit of nit picking so I could say something about this game that wasn't just positives. I really love this game, everything blends together so well. Every little thing is put into place so nicely. I really do thing this is one of my favorite modern platformers. I do have a problem with one thing though, for some reason when I beat the game I didn't get the achievement for beating the game on normal mode, but this does seem to be a one time glitch because I didn't see anyone else say anything about this.

Overall I rate this game a [b] 7.8/10 [/b] game is a bit short but the price isn't so bad and you should totally pick it up.

15771115.review:
[u][b][h1]Guns, Gore & Cannoli[/h1][/b][/u]

Hervorragender Zombie-Shooter in Zeiten der 30er, besser könnte es nicht sein.


[b][h1]~~~ Sound, Musik & Vertonung ~~~[/h1][/b]

Absolut richtig gemacht haben die Entwickler hier alles. Die Musik aus den 30ern passt zur gesamten Spielwelt, lässt eine in die altbekannte Mafiawelt abtauchen und gibt der Atmosphäre des Geballers noch eine erfrischende Melodie und fast schon einen gewissen Rhythmus.
Die Soundeffekte sind großartig, alles fließt wunderbar ineinander und vermischt sich zu einer gewaltigen Soundkulisse wie kaum noch in der heutigen Spielwelt vorhanden.
Selbst die Vertonung der Charaktere ist große Klasse!
Wer hier meckert, der braucht wahrscheinlich eine neue Soundkarte. Denn die Qualität ist wirklich auf höchstem Niveau, prima gemacht!


[b][h1]~~~ Gameplay ~~~[/h1][/b]

Schnelle Einführung dank hilfreicher Tutorials die direkt bei Start sämtliche Funktionen erklären.
Das Spiel läuft wahnsinnig flüssig, keine Ruckler oder irgendwelche Fehler, nichts was einem aus der wundervollen Spielwelt rausreißt.
Die Tastaturbelegung lässt sich schnell und einfach ein- und umstellen. Mir gefiel insbesonders dass selbst das Tutorial anbietet die Tastatur nach beliebem zu belegen.
Die Geschichte hier ist zwar mal etwas anderes, aber keineswegs schlechter!
Im Gegenteil: Guns, Gore & Cannoli vermischt Zombieschlächterei mit den Mobs aus einer fast schon vergessenen Ära der USA; alles zu Zeiten der Prohibition.
Die Künstliche Intelligenz zeigt hier ihr richtiges Potenzial, denn die etwas spezielleren Zombies sind keineswegs dumm, ebenso wenig wie verfeindete Mafia-Familien, beide Seiten wissen ihre Möglichkeiten zu nutzen und können selbst auf dem Schwierigkeitsgrad "Normal" dem Spieler das Leben schwer machen.
Was mir hier besonders gefiel ist die Tatsache, dass selbst Zombies und andere Menschen sich gegeneinander bekriegen, wer hätte das gedacht? Normalität? Sollte man meinen! Meistens kriegt man jedoch einfach nur einen Schießbuden-Simulator der Welle für Welle verschiedene Typen der Gegner vermischt, was schon sehr lieblos umgesetzt ist.
Aber keineswegs hier!
Die Entwickler haben alles richtig gemacht!
Langzeitmotivation ist hier auf jeden Fall vorhanden, auch wenn es nur ein kleiner 2D-Shooter ist. 
Die Waffen die hier zum Einsatz kommen passen auch in die gewählte Zeit, keiner möchte in einem 30er Jahre Spiel Laserwaffen vorfinden.
Das Einzige was etwas negativ auffällt, ist dass nicht immer genau klar wird welche Anbauten man betreten kann.
Denn es ist bei weitem nicht jede Treppe und nicht jedes Rohr begehbar, und so kann das Ausprobieren mal schnell zu einem schnellen Tod im lodernden Feuer führen.
All das jedoch tut dem Spiel keinen Abbruch!
Man gewöhnt sich schnell an die Umgebung und hat auch nach einigen Versuchen und Fehlschlägen ein Gefühl für das was geht oder nicht.
Auch hier kann man nur sagen: Prima gemacht! 


[b][h1]~~~ Grafik ~~~[/h1][/b]

Guns, Gore & Cannoli setzt auf ein Comic-Ambiente, was hier mit sehr viel Detaillverliebtheit, Liebe und Mühe gestaltet wurde.
Charaktere, sowohl Menschen als auch Zombies wirken authentisch und echt. Effekte von bspw. Molotov-Cocktails oder Granaten sind mehr als schön und rufen den Wunsch des kleinen Feuerteufels hervor, nach mehr Explosionen und Feuer. 
Wenn zündeln doch immer so schön sein könnte..
Sterbe-Anmiationen laufen perfekt von der Hand und geben neben dem Zündelwunsch, auch das Verlangen nach mehr Munition zum schnetzeln.
Was kann man hier groß sagen?
Man spürt dass Herzblut hineingeflossen ist und wirklich Arbeit dahinter steckt.


[b][h1]~~~ Bewertung ~~~[/h1][/b]

Was kann man mehr zu einer ausgezeichneten, liebevoll gestalteten Spielwelt und Geschichte sagen, als: Bravo!
Nichts. Das Spiel punktet in allem und hat tatsächlich keinerlei Punkte die gegen einen Kauf sprechen.
Hier sind Stunden von Arbeit, Mühe und viel Liebe zum Detail zusammengekommen und das gehört belohnt!

+ Einfache Steuerung für Jedermann
+ Langzeitmotivierend
+ Geschichte macht Lust auf mehr
+ Details kommen wunderbar zu Geltung
+ Authentische Umgebung

++ Zwei Extrapunkte für den Mut, Mafia und Zombies zu kombinieren. Denn das funktioniert hier mehr als gut!
Als auch für die Tatsache, dass es sowohl Gelegenheitsspieler, als auch Zombie und Mafia Liebhaber ein schönes Spielerlebnis bietet. 

Guns, Gore & Cannoli ist keineswegs ein lieblos verwursteter Mix aus verschiedenen Genres, es ist eine ausgezeichnete Mischung aus Mafia, Zombies, und hält ordentlich Knarren und Geballer bereit!


15/10
Definitiv Kaufempfehlung!

15756250.review:
Have you ever wanted a side scrolling action game that plays like the ones you remember playing back in the 80's and 90's?
Well Guns, Gore & Cannoli does just that and with four player local co-op, atleast for the time being as online co-op might be added in the near future.
You don't have to worry about gathering money and such as there's none of that, you simply find weapons that you use for the rest of the game, some of them don't need upgrading anyway like the flamethrower and rocket launcher as they can send zombies, humans and mutants alike flying all over the place.
Plus the voice acting of Vinnie and the other characters is quite well done, especially since most of the gangsters speak with the kind of over-the-top accent that you'd expect a mafioso of that era to have.
This is old school side scrolling action at its finest and should not be passed up by those who enjoyed games like Duke Nukem 2 and others back in the old days.

+ местами игра бросает вызов и становится довольно сложной, особенно встречи с боссами. Пройти её с автоматом наперевес, вынося всё живое, не получится. Нужно менять оружие в зависимости от ситуации и соперника
+ красивая мультяшная графика, хорошо проработанные эффекты (например, при перезарядке обреза на землю падают гильзы, при броске гранаты - чека, и т.д.) Можно встретить даже пару плакатов на русском языке (Анастасия + Матиас навсегда :))
+ качественно подобранная музыка, добавляющая атмосферности, причём на каждом уровне своя мелодия. Да и вообще всё, что касается звука, сделано очень хорошо - выстрелы, взрывы, озвучка зомби и т.д.
+ игра переведена на русский язык, правда только субтитры и подсказки. Озвучка роликов осталась на английском. Перевод не идеален, встречаются ошибки и неудачные фразы, но я работаю над этим. На днях написал разработчикам, они ответили, что готовы внести исправления
+ можно играть вместе с другом (двое игроков за одним ПК). Мультиплеера нет, но он и не нужен
+ игра средней продолжительности. Она проходится ровно столько, чтобы не успеть наскучить
+ довольно простой, но всё же интересный сюжет с необычной развязкой
+ цена всего 250 руб. Даже я, покупающий игры только на распродажах, не поскупился и заплатил полную цену.

Минусы:
- пожалуй, только небольшая однообразность игрового процесса. Но если проходить игру не запоем, а разбить на 2-3 вечера, то вы этого не заметите. К тому же разработчики постарались максимально разнообразить прохождение - 10 видов оружия, разные типы зомби, интересные боссы.

15681422.review:
A very good 2D platformer.  I downloaded the demo which consists of the complete Bonnino's Stripclub level in October from Mod DB.  It was an immediate hit at my house and got put on 4 gaming PCs.  Having bought the full game I'm equally pleased and it's good to see so many positive reviews.

Anyway the demo is still available and I recommend you DL it.  Note, the demo only supports 2 player co-op while the released game supports 4 players.  Co-op usually makes most games easier but not this one (at least the demo version).  I think this is a plus as you can't simply spam your way out of trouble.

If you play on "easy" (one of the 4 skill levels) you can complete the game in about 3 hours (and much faster if you speed run).  However, to gain 100 percent achievements you would have to play on impossible and this will make some of the achievements really hard so you would be wise to do a run through on easy and then play again on impossible.

15655252.review:
Guns, Gore and Cannoli is a 2D side scrolling action platformer in the style of Metal Slug. You play Vinnie Cannoli, a mobster working for a large family, traveling to a town plagued by zombies and rival gangsters. The story is pretty basic, but fun. You could totally enjoy the game by skipping the cutscenes, but I don't regret watching them, they ended up being pretty funny and the voice acting is pretty good.

The gameplay is simple, your shooting zombies/people. I was very happy when I realized I'd be fighting more than just zombies, I feel that would have gotten old pretty quickly. The game does shine in variety, however. By the end of the game, you have a total of 10 different guns, ranging from a pistol with infinite ammo to a Tesla gun, used to electrify your opponents. Weapons are more viable against certain enemies, which makes it a lot harder to just run through the game with the pistol(although I'm sure its possible). The game also has a nice variety of enemies. There are several types of zombies, including ones that will chase you down the map, big exploding zombies, and more average zombies that are only aggressive when you're next to them. You also fight soldiers and other mobsters, each with their own variety of enemy types. As you can see, the game shakes it up throughout

I enjoy the game greatly, but obviously its not perfect. The biggest issue I have is with the AI. While its competent most of the time, and I do like that zombies won't avoid grenades but regular people will(nice touch), I've found the AI killed themselves more times than I'd like. There are stages that should probably be hard that you can exploit to get the enemies to kill themselves. I'm not talking about the Zombies here, I'm talking about the regular people, and they should be smarter than that. But, the AI overall is pretty competent but its not perfect. The last complaint I'd make is the length. I get the game is meant to be replayed, so its short to warrant other playthroughs, but for people like me that want to play through different games, and only replay a handful of games more than once, it makes it hard to recommend at full price. I still would, but its harder.

Overall Guns, Gore & Cannoli is a well done 2D action platformer, that has great gameplay with a strong mix of enemy types. If you worry about things like $1/hr of enjoyment, maybe wait for a sale. Otherwise, I recommend it, Especially if you have someone locally to play with.

[h1][u] Buy At Full Price [h1][u]

15651469.review:
[h1] No grindy unlocks, no boring collectibles, no superficial score or time counts... this is raw, baby! [/h1]

...and I love it for that! 

I`m a little tired of the flood of typical 2D side-scroller with their 8-bit looks and sound. A pixelated look does not necessarily deliver an old school gaming experience. 

Well, this game here comes very close to what I think is a very good "gaming in the 80`s experience" and it does so without the blocky look of its competition. And it`s pure survival, no leaderboard race...

What fascinates me, besides the artwork and sound, is the flow of events you take part in. The weapons, enemies and levels are very well designed and after a while of playing you feel like the main dancer in a gun ballet...

You can handle each situation with your standard pistol, you are never defenseless, it`s just a little bit more fun to take out the other surgical instruments. Some guns are better in specific situations, but basically you could use the pistol throughout the whole game and this, in my opinion, is very good game design.

And if you solve a tricky situation with just your standard piece it will put a huge grin on your face.

What else makes me smile all the time? The reloading animations and general physics engine! 

It`s just fun to see (and hear) how your guy is reloading the good old double-barrel shotgun, and the empty cases gently sliding down an elevation. After reloading the pistol he is even pulling back the slide... 

The levels offer a great variety of putting your gun ballet dancing to the test and are well balanced. At some points you just need to rush through a room guns blazing and then there are other moments in which you can pause and hide behind an obstacle... 

...and speaking of the grin you got while playing: The chain reactions caused by a misthrown grenade are just hilarious.

So, my final words regarding this game:

[i] To the developers: Where can I sign-in for a monthly subscription of more levels, enemies ... more everything?

To you: Never forget to reload your gun after a shoot-out! 

(If you don`t ... meh, it doesn`t matter anyway, if this game is your thing you will just smile and return ...double prepared this time, of course) [/i]

If 2D enforcing for the mob is something you always wanted to try this game is an offer you can`t refuse!

Игрой я заинтересовался ещё тогда, когда она стартовала на гринлайте - люблю платформеры, да тут ещё и стиль весьма необычный. И вот игра вышла, я сразу купил её. И разочаровался. Купился на рекламные ролики, которые создают образ интересной игры. Увы, это всего-лишь образ. Необычайно скучный продукт. Забавная стилистика - это всё что есть в этой игре. Геймплей прост как две копейки - иди вперёд по уровню да отстреливай мобов. В играх типа MatalSlug\contra подобным заниматься весело, но тут никакого удовольствия от процесса не получаешь. Персонаж умеет стрелять только по горизонтали. Всё оружие открывается в первой половине игры. Однообразные уровни, однообразные враги и ситуации. Игра проходится буквально за 3 часа в неспешном темпе. Сюжет тут только для галочки. Также очень скучное музыкальное сопровождение. Это вообще странно, ибо в стиме написано, что игра где-то номинирована на очередную инди-премию как раз из-за звука.
Возможно игру бы спас онлайн-кооп, но увы - разработчики отказались его добавлять по причине отсутствия бюджета. Вообще, по игре складывается впечатление крайне низкобюджетного продукта - сплошная копипаста и скука.
В принципе, играть в это можно, но никакого удовольствия процесс не приносит. Так что увы - порекомендовать игру не могу. Как итог - 5\10

15644276.review:
It's always nice to come home to your wife and hear the line: "Hey Honey, you still know the Claeys brothers, don't you? One of their wifes was just here and she mentioned they are releasing a game at the end of the month."
My heart skipped a beat the moment that I found out that they are releasing a metal slug like game.
The NeoGeo was always a diamond for it's age. And Metal slug only kept his throne warm. It's good to see that Guns, Gore and Cannolli is giving me the same chills in their gameplay.

I've always been a fan of the claeys brothers artwork. From everything I've seen, from posters, art work of their baby-announcement, they always put their heart and soul into everything they draw. And the art style within this game goes the same way. 
The levels feel and breath anno 1920, though with alot of Z-apocalypse sause trown over it.
It's noticable that the levels are sometimes made out of the same toolsets. The same lorry from last level was blocking again my passthrough towards finding Frankie. But the variation of the levels don't make it feel far from repetitive.  You'll encounter the same foe a few times through every level, though as they've added a whole army of different zombies to butcher, you can live up to every challenge as if it's a new one.

The gameplay feels fluid, your character reacts as it should and the bullets fly whenever I feel like pushing the trigger. Through the whole playtrough, I never had a single glitch or death related to the keys that I've pressed. From time to time you can blow up a car and the doors will still twirl like a little ballerina bumping up to the garage door. But you'll only notice that once of twice in the whole game.

The soundtrack and the voice acting only enhances the fact that you're being pulled into the game. The nice Italian accent and the hand guestures only make you wanne go more to an italian and have some "good cannoli". The story isn't too deep, but you'll love the story just for it's humor. The oneliners they throw in once in a while add up to that. :)

Gameplay is very forgiving. You'll always end up at your last checkpoint on death, with the same armory and health when you last passed through. Zombies bite, but don't kill you instantly on normal difficulty. Going to harder modes you'll need to be skillfull to stay alive though. The difficulty can be changed any time, but I like the  "try till you finally survive" aproach alot more.

The game isn't too long. But it's very replayable and enjoyable. And for it's price, it's a bargain for it's quality.

15642800.review:
Well, you've been reading other reviews before reading mine, so I'll try highlighting something different.

Metal Slug is mentioned a lot by the others. 
True, this Guns, Gore & Cannoli game is also a 2d side-scrolling shooter platformer. 
In terms of the zombie warfare mechanism though, personally I think GGC is  better.

Why do I say so?
To deal with zombies in Metal Slug, you have several options, eg:
- shooting any part of the zombie does equal damage
- being trigger happy, shoot everything that moves with whatever weapon you are using.
- or you can just run away past them
- if you don't have a special weapon, then spam rapid fire of your basic, infinite bullets handgun.
- get close to the zombies and melee them to death with a knife or several kicks

To deal with zombies in Guns, Gore & Cannoli,:
- headshots usually offer the fastest kill per zombie
- you have to manage your ammo since it carries over to subsequent areas
- knowing how and when to use a certain weapon is very useful
(eg single handgun shot for a lone zombie, grenade for a group of zombies, flamethrower for a really large horde,etc)
- running past enemies is usually a bad idea, they will chase you throughout the level. (and there are a lot)
- you don't have a reliable melee attack to kill enemies. Kicking enemies only helps you get a few seconds to reload weapons. Unless you kick them into fire or off a rooftop. I guess that counts as melee kill?

15625872.review:
次々と現れるゾンビやギャングを撃ちまくる2D横スクロールアクション。
さまざまな武器を特殊能力を持った敵に合わせて使い分けて戦っていきます。普通のゾンビだけではなく、HSしか効かないゾンビ、風船で空を飛ぶゾンビやタックルをしてくるがっちりとした体型のゾンビ、ナイフを投げてくるシェフゾンビ、毒ガスを吐いてくるBBA、普通のギャング、バットで襲いかかってくるギャングなど、この他にも大勢。
面倒なときはグレネードとモロトフが至る所に置いてあるので投げまくろう。

グロテスクな表現が苦手な方にはおすすめできないけど、そうでないなら爽快感抜群！！
難易度NORMALでプレイしてますが、その名の通り適度な難易度です。ボス戦や板挟みになるシーンでは何回か死んだりと少し難しいところはありますが、チェックポイントは多めだし何も考えずにプレイしたいときにはEASYもあるし、更に2つ上の難易度があるので歯応えを求めたいときもこのゲームが使えます。ちなみに、ラスボス戦第三戦はちゃんと考えないと死にます。敵の銃撃が当たらない場所で待機しながら隙を見てロケットランチャーで狙うんだ！！
最初攻略方法が分からなくて30回死んだけど気のせいだよね。

ストーリーは英語ですが、興味があったら読むのをチャレンジしてみて。

!!こんな人におすすめ!!

・横スクロールアクションがやりたい!!
・低スペックだけどゲームしたい
・トミーガンが使いたい
・ゾンビもいいけどギャングもいい
・ショットガンで敵を吹っ飛ばすのが給料日の朝の感覚より好き
・もう何でもいい


最後に注意点として、デフォルト設定ではキー操作が訳分からんことになってます。攻撃がJとか、キックがKとか。
そのままだと（少なくとも自分は）ゾンビ化しそうになるくらい操作が難しいので、攻撃とキックをマウスクリックに設定した方がいいです。後はグレネードはG、モロトフはMouse2とか操作しやすいように設定しておくといいです。

操作設定が終わったらLet's Start!!

15624282.review:
[table][tr][th][h1][b]FR[/b][/h1][/th][th][h1][u]Il ira plus loin que l'on aurait pu le croire ?[/u]  [/h1][/th][th]v. 0 -[/th][/tr][/table][i]Ne vous laissez pas refroidir par « voyouville » (Thugstown)...[/i]
Si je suis Belge, je n'ai pas de goût ou de sensibilité spéciale que ce soit pour la bande dessinée ou les “Comics”. Peu importe, cela ne m'empêche pas d'apprécier Guns, Gore & Cannoli. 
Sur un tel titre, ma première appréhension serait venue d'ordinaire des mondes auxquels ce dernier serait destiné. Comprenez console, tablette, etc. 
Presque inexplicablement, cette sortie initiale ne se fait qu'à l'échelle du PC/Mac (nul doute que d'autres supports suivront). 
Malgré le pc, l'expérience est pensée, comme beaucoup d'autres, pour le Pad (vous savez « compatible clavier, mais manette recommandée »). 

[h1]Du contrôle[/h1]
Donc, première surprise, pas de visée, tenez vous debout pour un tire de hanche, mettez-vous à croupi pour tiré de plus bas, vous suivez l'esprit... Même si cela m’a déçu, le titre se rattrape rapidement avec une maniabilité de grande qualité. 
Votre héros, peut courir, sauter, se baisser, se retourner et jamais aucune de ces actions ne verrouillent le tire, vous êtes libre durant vos figures de placer certains tires précis, vers des éléments du décors, ou n'importe quoi d'autre pour agir sur la scène, même à plus grande distance. Sans visée, les dégâts produits bénéficient néanmoins d'une localisation légère, une tête peut éclater nette et un toucher le torse peut provoquer l'effondrement "propre" de l'ennemi. 

La balistique est gratifiante, le pistolet initial peut être utilisé à l'envi, le fusil à canon scié bénéficie d'un fort pouvoir d'arrêt, etc. Selon votre arme et sa portée, ce n'est pas uniquement le premier sujet sur la trajectoire qui subira des dégâts, mais toute la colonne. 

[h1]Où sont les cases ?[/h1]
Visuellement, je le disais, je ne pourrai pas m'étendre (même si j'adorerai pouvoir parler de techniques ou d'influences). Je suis heureux de voir un style bande dessinée européen (voire Belge ?) et non pas américain. La résolution de votre écran importe peu pour un tel jeu. C'est la taille sur laquelle on étire le dessin qui prime, sachez que rien ne bave ni n'offre de profil mal défini sur un écran 27" (1440p). C'est tout à fait impressionnant ! Les animations sont nombreuses, respiration, les dents serrées lors d'un tire. 
L'eau clapote, la lumière du feu palpite. Les effets sont également très détaillés pour  provoquer une joie bête et méchante lorsque quelqu'un éclate ou s'embrase. Si le jeu se revendique Gore, ce n'est pas à prendre au pied de la lettre. C'est naïf bien plus que ce n'est réaliste. 

S'il vous fallait un point de comparaison, je vous inviterais à penser à Plant vs. Zombie, les mécaniques des cohortes d’ennemis sont vastes et s'écoulent en nombre sur vous. Le flot peut être bloqué, coincé, venir de gauche, de droite ou sur votre verticale. Délicieuse surprise, le saut peut même être maintenu un court instant, c'est irréel, mais donne du tonus à l'action et à la technicité du jeu. 

Enfin, la difficulté est au rendez-vous, déclinée en 4 variations, elle ne manquera pas d'offrir un challenge au plus hardcore d'entre nous ! 
Guns, Gore & Cannoli offre un style unique que l'industrie du jeu connaît mal et rafraîchira plus que sans doute un public international. Si un mode coopératif existe, je regrette déjà qu'il ne puisse être joué qu'en local (sur un même écran).

15621954.review:
It's an extremely fun game if you like 2D scrolling shooters, similar to the likes of Metal Slug.

The story, hand drawn graphics, music, sounds effects and animations are all fantastic. It's so satisfying firing that shotgun, hearing the cartridges drop to the flaw and then it being reloaded. All in the middle of pure carnage.

There are a variety of enemies, although many are well known if you've played Left 4 Dead. Which is no fault to the developers at all. There are only so many variations of zombies you can get.

The 1920's setting is extremely fun, and I've always enjoyed shows, movies, and games set in the period. Guns, Gore & Cannoli is no exception.

The narration is done rather well, with comments being thrown about mid fight from the protagonist Vinne; which only adds to the atmosphere of the game and your current situation.

When it comes to weapons you have everything the 1920's was known for; from the world famous Tommy Gun with drum magazine to molotov cocktails and magnum revolvers. Each extremely satisfying to use in their own right. Not every enemy can be effectively taken out with any weapon, and finding the right tool for the job can be messy if you're suddenly overwhelmed by a small horde of face munchers.

Even so I've been really enjoying the game and would easily recommend it. It starts off well, and keeps the awesome flowing.

PC Gameplay

15620740.review:
// Guns, Gore & Canolli is a 2D Arcade Sidescroller Shooter: //
// Schuitje82 - Extended Review //


Background Info:
============
Developer: Crazy Mokey Studios
Engine: Unity
Genre: Action / Platformer
Mode: Single-player / Local Co-op
Release date: April 30th 2015


Personal Info:
==========
I really like this game... and what it makes it special for me.
What makes it extra special is that I have met the people behind the game.
This gives me total picture for the game and the people behind it.
Let you see and understand how much work / hours and passion for there product.


About the game:
============
The name of the game says almost everything about the game.
This is a great basic shoot 'm up like the game that brings me back to the beginning era of gaming. Very simple shoot and run game with hope guns, gore and canolli. Story line is very funny and wonderful put together.
Game has some amazing art and the creators did a really great job and I think this gives the game head jump from other indie games in the same genre.
The background music give you that totally feeling about the theme of the game.
I'm a a big soundtrack nerd so this are things that I think are very important..
Main character you play with have some great and funny lines that he says when pumping some lead in the freaking zombies. One of my favorites .... I sell lead by the kilo these days. :P

Controls:
======
I think this game can be played best with a controller I prefer the original Microsoft Xbox 360 Joypad / controller. The game plays very well and easy to learn because of the basic button layout like in the old arcade games from the ‘90 era.
When you start playing this game you will find out you only can shoot left or right most game I played in the ‘90 this can be weird in some way when you try to shoot some enemies that will attack you from the sky.
Kicking your enemies is a fun and easy way to attack you enemies without losing all of you bullits find it strange you can not use this when jumping.

Weapons:
========


There are a lot of different weapons in the game and further you play the story more you will find them no faster way for unlocking them.
Every weapons has been well balanced only I think you will always have a favorite one.
Personally I love the shotgun of his power and you can shoot multiple enemies with one shot.
Sometime you really can use it because they come with 4 or more zombies from all directions.
It's a shame there is no way to have all weapons from the beginning. (cheat code maby !!!) 
That would make the game extra fun to choose what weapon to have from the start.

Enemies:
=======

There some classes zombies like in every games only one I think the most annoying is the Rugby Zombie.
Because this one is very strong and sometimes need more than 3 hits to get it down.
Zombies are fun and give you a great challenge sometimes getting them out of your way.
Not to forget a few of them need to be kicked before you shoot... that helps a lot sometimes.
After you play not only the zombies will be your enemies so.... this is getting fun after some levels.

Multiplayer:
========
Game only supports co-op 4 player offline mode.
It's a shame maybe for some people only I prefer to play with some friend on the couch.
That will give that fun co-op like the old days if you not from that era ? It's fun...
I hope Online co-op will be added in the future with a update.
And I can't play with friend on the couch everyday :(
If enough people buy the game... maby this will happen ?

Finally:
=====
This is a great game.. people who like this platform will love this one.
It’s a shame the game has no online support so you will need to play this game offline like old times and some people will find it a little bit disappointing.
There is no level system, no items to collect.
It just a basic arcade shoot 'em up.

It's fun, It's haves a great gameplay, love the theme.
I give it a 9/10 score.

((Update 16-03-2016))
After some month the game is online the devs have added new multiplayer mode deathmatch.
It’s a fun way to play against your friends and yes only offline mode possible.
Game have a few maps to choose from and they added the option that every player can choose their own favorite skins.
And also story mode has the option for selecting your own character.

http://store.steampowered.com/app/322210
